unit: Unit 9 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Slopes
title: Ice Cream Shop | 3 of 3
question_text: An owner of a local ice cream shop wishes to determine if a positive linear relationship exists between high temperatures and the shopâ€™s profits recorded that day. The owner recorded sales from the last $50\text{ days}$ of the summer and performed a linear regression $T$ -interval on temperature vs. sales at $95\%$ confidence. If the interval extends from $50.2$ to $76.2$ , which of the following statements is/are true? I. Strong evidence exists $(p < 0.05)$ of a linear relationship between these variables. II. The model predicts an extra $\$63.20$ in sales for every extra degree the temperature rises. III. In this situation specifically, extrapolation is probably safe.
